to.desc: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'to' property; Superseeded by 'href' prop if used

exact.desc: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'exact' property; Superseeded by 'href' prop if used

replace.desc: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'replace' property; Superseeded by 'href' prop if used

active-class.desc: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'active-class' property; Superseeded by 'href' prop if used

exact-active-class.desc: Equivalent to Vue Router <router-link> 'active-class' property; Superseeded by 'href' prop if used

href.desc: Native <a> link href attribute; Has priority over the 'to'/'exact'/'replace'/'active-class'/'exact-active-class' props

target.desc: Native <a> link target attribute; Use it only along with 'href' prop; Has priority over the 'to'/'exact'/'replace'/'active-class'/'exact-active-class' props

label.desc: The label text for the breadcrumb

icon.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

ripple.desc: Configure material ripple (disable it by setting it to 'false' or supply a config object)
examples: { early: true, center: true, color: 'teal', keyCodes: [] }

default.desc: This is where custom content goes, unless 'icon' and 'label' props are not enough
